pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:0.5: 42. The training rule on sending away
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.1: On one occasion when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.2: Venerable Upananda the Sakyan said to his brother’s student,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.3: “Come, let’s go to the village for alms.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.4: Then, without getting him any food, he sent him away, saying,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.5: “Go away, I’m not comfortable talking or sitting with you, but only if I talk and sit by myself.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.6: But since the right time for eating was coming to an end, that student was not able to walk for alms. And while he was going back, there was nobody offering food, and so he missed his meal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.7: He then went to the monastery and told the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.8: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Upananda,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.9: “How can Venerable Upananda say to a monk, ‘Come, let’s go to the village for alms,’ and then send him away without getting him any food?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.10: “Is it true, Upananda, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.13: “… Foolish man, how can you say to a monk, ‘Come, let’s go to the village for alms,’ and then send him away without getting him any food?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.15: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:1.16.1: ‘If a monk says to a monk, “Come, let’s go to the village or town for alms,” and then, whether he has had food given to him or not, sends him away, saying, “Go away, I’m not comfortable talking or sitting with you, but only if I talk and sit by myself,” and he does so only for this reason and no other, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a unanimous Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.7: Come … to the village or town:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.8: a village, also a town, also a city; both a village and a town.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.9: He has had food given to him:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.10: he has had rice porridge, a meal, non-staples, or staples given to him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.12: he has not had anything given to him.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.14: if, wanting to laugh with a woman, wanting to enjoy himself with her, wanting to sit down in private with her, wanting to misbehave with her, he says, “Go away, I’m not comfortable talking or sitting with you, but only if I talk and sit by myself,” and he sends him away, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.15: If the other monk is in the process of going beyond the range of sight or the range of hearing, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.16: When the other monk has gone beyond, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.17: He does so only for this reason and no other:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.1.18: there is no other reason for sending him away.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.1: If the other monk is fully ordained, and he perceives him as such, and he sends him away, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.2: If the other monk is fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, and he sends him away, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.3: If the other monk is fully ordained, but he does not perceive him as such, and he sends him away, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.4: If he puts him down in front of others, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.5: If he sends away one who is not fully ordained, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.6: If he puts him down in front of others, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.7: If the other monk is not fully ordained, but he perceives him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.8: If the other monk is not fully ordained, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.2.9: If the other monk is not fully ordained, and he does not perceive him as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.2: if he sends him away, thinking, “Together we won’t get enough;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.3: if he sends him away, thinking, “If he sees these valuable goods, he’ll become greedy;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.4: if he sends him away, thinking, “If he sees this woman, he’ll become discontent with the monastic life;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.5: if he sends him away, saying, “Take the rice porridge or the meal or the non-staples or the staples to the one who is sick or to the one who is left behind or to the one who is guarding the dwellings;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.6: if he does not want to misbehave;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.7: if he sends him away when there is something to be done;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.9: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc42:2.3.10: The second rule, the training rule on sending away, is finished.
